alert.note: Alert for Emanuel (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:30PM EDT until April 05 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN EMANUEL COUNTY... At 530 PM EDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Swainsboro, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Swainsboro, Twin City, Garfield, Canoochee and Modoc. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
